definition: Abdullah (name)
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
surname Bu
see 蘿蔔|萝卜[luo2 bo5]
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
surname Du
birchleaf pear (tree)/to stop/to prevent/to restrict
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Mr. Abdullah has alleged a massive fraud in the poll.
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉生成投票过程中存在大范围欺诈。

sentences.english: Abdula Al-Iraqi (ph) characterized the relationship he forged with Iraqi officials as successful.
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉成功地建立了其与伊拉克官员的关系。

sentences.english: Abdullah didn’t want to be stoned for participating in adultery, did he?
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉不想因为通奸而被石头砸死，是吧？

sentences.english: With typical circumlocution, King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia recently said as much.
sentences.chinese: 沙特的阿卜杜拉国王最近也同样语意婉转说了不少。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama previewed this new round of personal diplomacy on Tuesday, when he welcomed Jordan's King Abdullah to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马是在白宫会晤约旦国王阿卜杜拉时说这番话的。

sentences.english: Abdullah II was very glad to meet with President Jiang in New York.
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉二世表示非常高兴在纽约与江主席会晤。

sentences.english: Suddenly, Abdullah and Rania faced many new responsibilities and challenges.
sentences.chinese: 此时，阿卜杜拉和雷妮亚所名临许多新的挑战与责任。

sentences.english: Their obstructionism will outlast King Abdullah's reign.
sentences.chinese: 他们的蓄意阻挠会比阿卜杜拉国王的统治持续得更久。

sentences.english: It was there that Rania met Abudllah, then a prince of Jordan.
sentences.chinese: 在这场晚宴上，雷妮亚与约旦王子阿卜杜拉相会。

sentences.english: The man, Ismael Abdurahman, is accused of assisting the escape of one of the prime suspects in the case.
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉汗被指控帮助一名主要嫌疑人逃跑。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Ahmed (name)
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Hassan (person name)/Hassan District
King Fahd of Saudi Arabia
pasha (loanword)
Ramadan (loanword)
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
(loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
Anwar Al Sadat
Sadiq or Sadik (name)
